item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Chicago Blackhawks forward Patrick Kane faces theft of services, other charges
item.description: Blackhawks forward Patrick Kane, the top overall pick in the 2007 NHL draft, was arrested early Sunday morning in Buffalo, N.Y., and charged with theft of services, criminal mischief and robbery in the second degree after an incident with a cab driver.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Bridgestone Invitational: Tiger Woods soars over Padraig Harrington to win
item.description: With another signature moment at Firestone, Tiger Woods won the Bridgestone Invitational on Sunday with a spectacular shot over water to a foot that sent him to a 5-under 65 and a remarkable rally over Padraig Harrington.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race to noon Monday
item.description: The NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Watkins Glen International has been postponed because of rain and rescheduled for Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Collins overshadows Owens as Titans beat Bills
item.description: Kerry Collins was sharp and Vince Young tentative for the Tennessee Titans in overshadowing Terrell Owens' debut for the Buffalo Bills.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Manager Ozzie Guillen vows retaliation if Chicago White Sox players get hit
item.description: White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen had a warning for the rest of the league: Hit our players and our pitchers will retaliate.

item.dc:creator: Buster Olney
item.title: Sources: Several teams interested in aquiring John Smoltz
item.description: Several teams have interest in acquiring John Smoltz, and major league sources say.

item.dc:creator: Mike Sando
item.title: St. Louis Rams lose Donnie Avery for 4-6 weeks with foot injury
item.description: The St. Louis Rams expect to be without starting receiver Donnie Avery for four to six weeks after the second-year pro suffered a foot injury, coach Steve Spagnuolo told reporters Sunday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Pujols plunked as Cards rally to sweep Bucs
item.description: Skip Schumaker's first career pinch-hit home run started a five-run eighth-inning rally, and the Cardinals finished off a three-game sweep by winning 7-3 Sunday.

item.dc:creator: Sal Paolantonio
item.title: Ex-Philadelphia Eagles tackle Runyan asking for medical clearance
item.description: Former Eagles tackle Jon Runyan is hoping to get medical clearance to begin working out for teams.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Agent: Eric Mangini's practice decision to blame for season-ending injury to Cleveland Browns receiver Syndric Steptoe
item.description: Browns reserve receiver Syndric Steptoe will miss the season with a torn labrum in his shoulder, and his agent says coach Eric Mangini's decision-making is to blame, the Cleveland Plain Dealer reported.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: West Virginia Mountaineers receiver Jock Sanders reinstated 6 months after DUI arrest
item.description: West Virginia has reinstated leading receiver Jock Sanders six months after a drunken-driving arrest in Morgantown.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Scott Dixon becomes IndyCar's career wins leader
item.description: Scott Dixon has become IndyCar's leader in career victories by pulling away from the field to capture the Indy 200 at Mid-Ohio.

item.dc:creator: Adam Rittenberg
item.title: Ohio State Buckeyes' Tyler Moeller hospitalized in fair condition
item.description: Ohio State junior linebacker Tyler Moeller remains hospitalized Sunday with an undisclosed injury while his Buckeyes teammates reported for the start of preseason camp.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Juan Martin del Potro beats Andy Roddick in Legg Mason final
item.description: Top-seeded Andy Roddick lost to Juan Martin Del Potro in the Legg Mason Tennis Classic final, falling 3-6, 7-5, 7-6 (6) to the defending champ.

item.dc:creator: Marc Stein
item.title: Minnesota Timberwolves to install Kurt Rambis as new coach
item.description: The Minnesota Timberwolves and Kurt Rambis have reached terms on a deal that will install Rambis as the Wolves' new head coach.
